## About Me {.smaller}
-   Mariah Caballero
  - Call me Dr./Professor Caballero, or Dr./Professor Cab
-   She/her pronouns
-   Second semester at Wellesley! 
- PhD in Community Research and Action from Vanderbilt University, concentration in Climate and Energy Policy
- Use GIS/data science, policy analysis, and EJ theory to conduct research

## About this Course {.smaller}
::: columns

::: {.column style="width: 70%;"}
- Environmental Justice tends to focus on *Distributional* and *Procedural* Justice
- My take on Environmental Justice: 
  - Expansive movement that welcomes everyone into belonging
  - Community-based
  - Solutions-focused
  - Expands ideas of justice to include both theory and methods
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}
![](images/forms_justice.png){.absolute bottom=0 right=0}
:::
:::

## How my own path inspired this course {.smaller}
- Vassar College (undergrad)
  - First conceptions of EJ + interdisciplinarity
- USEPA Drinking Water Management Branch 
  - Data to support lived experiences
  - Community engagement
- Vanderbilt CRA
  - Community engaged research
  - Interdisciplinary research for advocacy
  ![](images/grad.JPG){.absolute bottom=-60 right=0}

## Course Design
::: columns

:::{.column style="width: 60%; font-size: 60%;"}
- **Tuesdays:** Group and paired discussions on foundational EJ theory
- **Fridays:** Community case study data visualization activity (in-class pairs, submitted individually)  

  - **First 9 weeks:** Community case studies centered on past and present; introduction to R
  - **Last 5 weeks:** Present and future-looking community case studies; final project prep; guest lectures from EJ practitioners
:::

:::{.column style="width: 40%; font-size: 60%;"}
| Course Components                  | % of Grade  |
|------------------------------------|-------------|
| Participation + Attendance         | 10%         |
| Weekly Assignments                 | 65%         |
| Community Case Study Final Project | 25%         |

:::

:::

## My Pedogogical Goals{.smaller}
- **Reflect on your own identity** and how it relates to EJ-related research and action.
- Build a course community that **recognizes and values** one another's strengths.
- Learn applicable **interdisciplinary skills to research and advocate for** EJ-related challenges
  - Individual homework and group final project
  - All assignments are <= 10% 
  - I want our classroom to be a safe, kind, and generative space!

## Check-in
- What interests you about this course?
- Anything you're excited/unsure about?

## Housekeeping

## Office Hours 
- Optimized based on ES 202/206 student schedules, every student should be available for at least one of the following slots:
- Currently: 
  - Mon, 12-2 PM
  - Wed, 2-3:30 PM
  - Thurs, 4-5:15 PM

## Centering Activity (optional){.smaller}
- Life is busy, and we often have millions of things on our minds
- Centering activities are brief activities (< 5 minutes) meant to bring everyone into the present
- A student would be in charge of leading before each class 
- This could be...
  - A breathing exercise
  - A silly doodle
  - A journaling activity
  - Reading your favorite poem
  - Sharing your favorite new song
- Are we into this?

## Course Website
bookmark: https://mariahdaniellecaballero.github.io/ES-202/ 

## Generative AI Policy{.smaller}
::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
- Data centers use *overwhelming* amounts of energy and water to answer queries.
- It also poses significant threats to the learning outcomes of this class.
- Therefore, **I ask that you do not use it** for the following:
  - Summarizing or annoting readings
  - Generating code of any kind
  - Answering any questions on assignments
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
![](images/data_centers.jpg){}
:::
:::

## Late Policy{.smaller}
- Each student has **3 24-hour late passes**
- Can use multiple passes on one assignment deadline. 
- Work is not accepted after final exam period. 
- Passes are not transferable, resuable, or divisible. 
- After your late pass budget is exhausted, each additional 24-hour delay in assignment results in a 10% grade deduction.
- To use a late day, fill out the Google form in the Syllabus *before* the assignment deadline.


## For Monday
- Check course website for readings 
- Follow instructions for installing R on your device
- Note on snow: 
  - Class may be via Zoom, depending on conditions. Will let everyone know likely by Sunday evening.

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
